revision.text:
{{unreferenced|date=August 2008}} {{Infobox Military Conflict |conflict=Battle of Vilcaconga |image= |caption= |partof=the [[Spanish conquest of Peru]] |date=August to November 1533 |place=[[Vilcaconga]] mountain pass, present-day [[Peru]] |result=Decisive, possibly pyrrhic [[Spain|Spanish]] victory |combatant1=[[Image:Flag of New Spain.svg|22px]] [[Spanish Empire]]
[[Queacha|Native]] allies |combatant2=[[Inca Empire]] |commander1=[[Francisco Pizarro]]
[[Gonzalo Pizarro]]
[[Hernando Pizarro]]
[[Juan Pizarro (conquistador)|Juan Pizarro]]
[[Diego de Almagro]] |commander2=[[Quizquiz]] |strength1=300 Spaniards
Possibly native [[auxiliaries]] |strength2=Unknown |casualties1=Unknown, but reportedly high |casualties2=Unknown }} {{Campaignbox Spanish conquest of Peru}} After emerging as victors in the [[battle of Cajamarca]], some 180 Spaniards under [[Francisco Pizarro]] were in control of major parts of the vast [[Inca Empire]] and of its [[Sapa Inca|emperor]], [[Atahualpa]]. After recovering a vast [[ransom room|ransom]] for his release, Pizarro had the Inca executed on July 26 once his army disbanded and crossed the mountains to the south after rejoining [[Diego de Almagro]], commanding some 100 Spaniards. The Incas under Atahualpas commander [[Quizquiz]] possessed, after the previous victory in the [[Inca Civil War]] tens of thousand Inca warriors around the area of Inca capital [[Cuzco]], the main target of the Spanish conquistadors. The Inca general commanded to fortified the mountain pass at [[Vilcaconga]] where the Spaniards would have to pass, and managed to ambush them, with great losses for the invaders. After a counter-attack, however, the numerically outnumbered Spaniards managed to rout the Inca forces and press further towards Cuzco, [[battle of Cuzco|capturing the Inca capital]] by November 1533. {{coord missing|Peru}} [[Category:Conflicts in 1533|Vilcaconga]] [[Category:Spanish conquests in the Americas|Vilcaconga]] [[Category:Battles involving Spain|Vilcaconga]] [[Category:Battles involving the Inca Empire|Vilcaconga]] [[Category:1533 in the Inca civilization]] [[Category:16th century in Peru]] [[Category:1533 in the Spanish Empire]]
